content:
# The smelting process has successfully produced 10 iron plates, but my inventory now shows:
# - 10 Iron Ore remaining
# - 1 Iron Plate
# - 10 Stone
# - 13 Coal

# The furnace is currently working and has 7 iron ore left to smelt into plates. 
# The Burner Mining Drill, however, is showing a status of "NO_MINABLE_RESOURCES," indicating that it has exhausted the nearby iron ore patch.

# To continue progressing, I need to extract the iron plates from the furnace and then check if I can craft the Iron Chest now that I have enough resources.

# First, I will extract the iron plates from the furnace.
extracted_plate_quantity = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace_position, quantity=10)  # Extract all 10 iron plates
assert extracted_plate_quantity == 10, "Failed to extract iron plates from the furnace."

# Now, let's check the inventory after extracting the plates.
print(f"Inventory after extracting plates: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Now that I have enough iron plates, I can craft the Iron Chest.
# I will check the crafting requirements for the Iron Chest again.
chest_recipe = get_prototype_recipe(Prototype.IronChest)
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 2, \
    "Not enough iron plates to craft an Iron Chest. Check inventory for iron plates."

# Craft the Iron Chest
crafted_chest_amount = craft_item(Prototype.IronChest)
assert crafted_chest_amount == 1, "Failed to craft an Iron Chest due to insufficient materials or inventory space."

# Finally, check the inventory again to see the result after crafting the chest.
print(f"Inventory after crafting Iron Chest: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
